ecological_significance: Shorter stipes compensate for low conductivity (1)
Species in more stressful environments invest in thicker leaves (5)
Noncordate morphology reduces drying rates by holding external water in crevices and folds (6,7)
Enable asexual reproduction, thereby overcoming local extinction due to drying (8)
Lipophilic exudates produced by glands may reduce transpiration rates (9)
Hairs reduce drying rates by holding external water and increasing boundary layer thickness (6)
